entry.title: 英语学习计划
entry.content:
英语学习计划

A1-A2-Vocabulary

完成时间主题说明
1AccessoriesDo the exercises to learn the words for some accessories.
2ActionsDo the exercises and learn the words for some common actions.
3Appearance 1Do the exercises to learn words to describe people’s appearance.
4BedroomsDo these exercises to learn words to talk about your bedroom.
5Body parts 1Do these exercises to learn words for parts of the body.
6Clothes 1Do the exercises to learn words for different kinds of clothes.
7Clothes 2Do the exercises to learn vocabulary to talk about clothes.
8ColoursDo these exercises to learn the names of colours. What’s your favourite colour?
9Daily routineDo the exercises and learn how to talk about what you do every day.
10DrinksDo these exercises to learn the names of some common drinks.
11Everyday objectsLearn words for everyday objects by doing these exercises.
12Farm animalsLearn words for some farm animals and pets by doing these exercises.
13Food in Britain 1What do people eat in the UK? Do these exercises and learn words for some common foods in Britain.
14Food in Britain 2Vocabulary exercises to help learn words for more common foods in Britain.
15Fruit 1Do these exercises and learn words for some common fruits.
16HolidaysVocabulary exercises to help learn words for talking about holidays.
17HomesDo these exercises and learn words to talk about your home.
18HotelsWhat’s the word for a bed for two people? Learn this and other words to talk about staying in a hotel with these exercises.
19Jobs 1Learn words for different jobs in these exercises. Is your job in the list?
20Jobs 2Do these exercises and learn the names of more jobs. Have you ever done any of these jobs?
21Kitchens 1Do these exercises to learn words for things you find in a kitchen.
22Living roomsWhat do you call the object that we use to control the TV? Learn this and other words for things you find in a living room by doing these exercises.
23Meals and cookingDo these exercises and learn words to talk about meals and ways of cooking food.
24MoneyDo you know what a ‘cheque’ is? Find out and learn other words to talk about money by doing these vocabulary exercises.
25MovingWhat is the word for moving a ball with your foot? Do these exercises about words for movements and find out.
26Nature 1Vocabulary exercises to help learn words to talk about nature.
27Places in a town 1Do these exercises and improve your vocabulary for talking about places in a town.
28Restaurants 1Do these exercises and learn words to talk about things in a restaurant.
29SchoolDo these exercises and learn words for things at school.
30ShoppingDo these exercises and learn words to talk about shopping.
31Snacks and desserts in BritainVocabulary exercises to help learn words for some snacks and desserts in Britain.
32Transport 1Do these exercises to improve your vocabulary and learn words to talk about transport.
33Transport 2Do these exercises to learn more words for different kinds of transport.
34WeatherDo these exercises and learn some words to talk about the weather.

B1-B2-Vocabulary

完成时间主题说明
1Air travelDo the exercises to improve your vocabulary for air travel.
2Appearance 2Do you know what a ‘toddler’ is? Do these exercises and learn this and other words to talk about people’s appearance.
3Around townWhat’s the difference between a ‘crossing’ and a ‘crossroads’? Do these exercises to help learn words for the things around your town and find out.
4BathroomsLearn words for things in bathrooms by doing these exercises.
5BeachesAre you ready to go to the beach? Do these exercises and learn vocabulary to talk about the beach.
6Bicycles and motorbikesHow often do you ride a bicycle or motorbike? Learn some vocabulary for speaking about your bike by doing these exercises.
7Body parts 2What’s the difference between your thumbs and your toes? Do these exercises to find out and to learn vocabulary for more body parts.
8CarsDo you like to drive? Do these exercises to learn words related to cars.
9Christmas in the UKHappy Christmas! Do these exercises and learn words to talk about Christmas in the UK.
10ContainersLearn words for different containers by doing these exercises.
11FootballLearn some vocabulary for talking about football by doing these exercises.
12Fruit 2Learn more words for different kinds of fruit using these exercises!
13GardensDo these exercises and learn words for things you can see in gardens.
14HealthVocabulary exercises to help learn words related to health.
15Kitchens 2Learn more words for things you can find in a kitchen by doing these exercises.
16Meat and fishDo these vocabulary exercises and learn words for different kinds of meat and fish.
17Other animalsDo these vocabulary exercises and learn the names of some birds, insects and other animals.
18Streets and roadsDo you know what a ‘kerb’ is? Do these exercises and learn what it and other words related to streets and roads mean.
19ToolsLearn the names of some common tools by doing these exercises.
20Vegetables 1Do these exercises and learn the names of some common vegetables.
21Vegetables 2Vocabulary exercises to help learn words for more vegetables.
22Wild animalsDo these exercises and learn the names of some wild animals.

A1-A2-Grammar

完成时间主题说明
1Adjectives and prepositionsDo you know how to use adjectives with prepositions like interested in or similar to? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
2Adjectives ending in ‘-ed’ and ‘-ing’Do you know the difference between bored and boring? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
3Articles: ‘a’, ‘an’, ‘the’Do you know how to use a, an and the? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
4Articles: ‘the’ or no articleDo you know when you need to use the in common phrases and place names? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
5Comparative adjectivesDo you know how to use comparative adjectives like older, better and more interesting? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
6Infinitive of purposeDo you know how and when to use an infinitive to talk about purpose? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
7Nouns: countable and uncountableDo you know how to use a, some, any, much and many? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
8Past continuous and past simpleDo you know how to use the past continuous and past simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
9Possessive ‘sDo you know how to use possessive ‘s? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
10Prepositions of place – ‘in’, ‘on’, ‘at’Do you know how to use in, on and at to talk about location? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
11Prepositions of time: ‘at’, ‘in’, ‘on’Do you know how and when to use at, in and on to talk about time? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
12Present simpleDo you know how to use the present simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
13Present simple: ‘have got’Do you know how to use have and have got? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
14Present simple: ‘to be’Do you know how to use the verb to be in the present simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
15Quantifiers: ‘few’, ‘a few’, ‘little’ and ‘a bit of’Do you know how to use a few, few, very little and a bit of? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
16Question formsDo you know how to make questions? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
17Using ‘there is’ and ‘there are’Do you know how to use there is and there are? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
18Verbs followed by ‘-ing’ or infinitiveDo you know when to use -ing and when to use to + infinitive after a verb? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.

B1-B2-Grammar

完成时间主题说明
1Adjectives: gradable and non-gradableDo you know how to use adjectives in phrases like a bit cold, really cold and absolutely freezing? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
2British English and American EnglishDo you know any differences between British and American English? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
3Capital letters and apostrophesDo you know how to use capital letters and apostrophes correctly? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
4Conditionals: third and mixedDo you know how to use third conditionals and mixed conditionals? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
5Conditionals: zero, first and secondDo you know how to use the zero, first and second conditionals? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
6Contrasting ideas: ‘although’, ‘despite’ and othersDo you know how to connect two contrasting ideas with words like although and despite? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
7Different uses of ‘used to’Do you know the difference between I used to drive on the left and I’m used to driving on the left? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
8Future continuous and future perfectDo you know how to use phrases like I’ll be studying or I’ll have finished? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
9Future forms: ‘will’, ‘be going to’ and present continuousDo you know how to talk about future plans using will, going to and the present continuous? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
10Intensifiers: ‘so’ and ‘such’Do you know how to use the words so and such? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
11Modals: deductions about the pastDo you know how to use modal verbs to show how certain you are about past events? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
12Modals: deductions about the presentDo you know how to use modal verbs to say how certain you are about a possibility? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
13Modals: permission and obligationDo you know how to use modal verbs to talk about permission and obligation? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
14Modifying comparativesDo you know how to use phrases like much shorter than, almost as fit as and exactly the same as? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
15PassivesDo you know how to use the passive voice to change the focus of a sentence? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
16Past abilityDo you know how to use could, was able to and managed to to talk about past abilities? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
17Past habits: ‘used to’, ‘would’ and the past simpleDo you know how to talk about past habits using used to, would and the past simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
18Past perfectDo you know how to use phrases like They’d finished the project by March or Had you finished work when I called? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
19Phrasal verbsDo you know how to use verbs in phrases like pick the kids up, turn the music down and look after my cat? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
20Present perfectDo you know how to use phrases like She’s called every day this week, I’ve broken my leg and Have you ever been to Scotland? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
21Present perfect simple and continuousDo you know the difference between We’ve painted the room and We’ve been painting the room? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
22Present perfect: ‘just’, ‘yet’, ‘still’ and ‘already’Do you know how to use just, yet, still and already with the present perfect? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
23Question tagsDo you know how to use question tags like is he and didn’t you? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
24Reflexive pronounsDo you know how to use reflexive pronouns like myself, yourself or themselves? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
25Relative clauses: defining relative clausesDo you know how to define who or what you are talking about using relative clauses? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
26Relative clauses: non-defining relative clausesDo you know how to give extra information about someone or something using relative clauses? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
27Reported speech: questionsDo you know how to report a question that somebody asked? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
28Reported speech: reporting verbsDo you know how to tell someone what another person said using reporting verbs? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
29Reported speech: statementsDo you know how to report what somebody else said? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
30Stative verbsDo you know how to use stative verbs like think, love, smell and have? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
31The future: degrees of certaintyDo you know how to use phrases like will definitely, be likely to and probably won’t to say how sure you are about future events? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
32Using ‘as’ and ‘like’Do you know how to use like and as? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
33Using ‘enough’Do you know how to use the word enough? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
34Verbs and prepositionsDo you know how to use the prepositions for, from, in, of, on, to and with after verbs? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
35Verbs followed by ‘-ing’ or infinitive to change meaningDo you know the difference between stop doing something and stop to do something? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
36Wishes: ‘wish’ and ‘if only’Do you know how to use wish and if only to talk about things you would like to change? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.

C1-Grammar

完成时间主题说明
1Advanced passives reviewDo you know how to use all the different forms of the passive? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
2Advanced present simple and continuousDo you know all the different uses of present simple and continuous? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
3Avoiding repetition in a textDo you know how to use words like this, that, such and so to avoid repetition in a text? Read the explanation to find out and do the interactive exercises to practise.
4Contrasting ideasDo you know how to give contrasting information using conjunctions such as despite, much as and whereas? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
5EllipsisDo you know how to leave out words to make your English sound more natural? Test what you know about ellipsis with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
6Emphasis: cleft sentences, inversion and auxiliariesDo you know how to add emphasis using cleft sentences, inversion or auxiliaries? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
7Inversion after negative adverbialsDo you know how to use inversion after negative adverbials like Not only, Barely and Only? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
8Inversion and conditionalsDo you know how to use inversion in conditional sentences? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
9Modals: probabilityDo you know how to use modal verbs and other expressions to show how probable you think something is? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
10Participle clausesDo you know how to use participle clauses to say information in a more economical way? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
11Patterns with reporting verbsDo you know how to use reporting verbs in a sentence? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
12Possession and noun modifiersDo you know how to use noun modifiers or different possessive forms? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
13Unreal timeDo you know how to talk about unreal situations by shifting the verb form backwards? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
14Word order in phrasal verbsDo you know how to put words in the right order when using phrasal verbs? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.

A2-Listening

完成时间主题说明
12024-03-22 09:01A morning briefingListen to a morning briefing to practise and improve your listening skills.
22024-03-22 09:02An invitation to a partyListen to some phone messages with directions to practise and improve your listening skills.
32024-03-22 09:03Changing a meeting timeListen to two colleagues arranging a meeting to practise and improve your listening skills.
42024-03-22 09:04Changing plansListen to two people talking about changing their plans to practise and improve your listening skills.
52024-03-22 09:05Facts and figuresListen to the lecturer giving some facts and figures to practise and improve your listening skills.
62024-03-22 09:06Four conversationsListen to four conversations to practise and improve your listening skills.
72024-03-22 09:07Instructions for an assignmentListen to a university teacher giving instructions for an assignment to practise and improve your listening skills.
82024-03-22 09:08Leaving a messageListen to someone leaving a message to practise and improve your listening skills.
92024-03-22 09:09Missing a classListen to a student explain why she can’t come to class to practise and improve your listening skills.
102024-03-22 09:10Transport announcementsListen to some transport announcements to practise and improve your listening skills.
112024-03-22 09:11Understanding an explanationListen to a professor’s explanation to practise and improve your listening skills.
122024-03-22 09:12Who’s who in the officeListen to two people talking about the people in their office to practise and improve your listening skills.

B1-Listening

完成时间主题说明
1A phone call from a customerListen to the phone call from a customer to practise and improve your listening skills.
2A student discussionListen to two students comparing Mars and Earth to practise and improve your listening skills.
3A team meeting about diversityListen to a team meeting about diversity to practise and improve your listening skills.
4A weather forecastListen to a weather forecast and answer the questions to practise and improve your listening skills.
5An interview about listening skillsListen to the English teacher talk about listening to practise and improve your listening skills.
6An introduction to a lectureListen to the introduction of a psychology lecture to practise and improve your listening skills.
7Arriving late to classListen to the conversation between two students to practise and improve your listening skills.
8At the chemistListen to a conversation at a chemist’s to practise and improve your listening skills.
9Chatting about a seriesListen to two friends chatting about a television series to practise and improve your listening skills.

11Meeting an old friendListen to the conversation between two old friends to practise and improve your listening skills.
12Work–life balanceListen to a radio interview about maintaining a good work–life balance to practise and improve your listening skills.

B2-Listening

完成时间主题说明
1A business interviewListen to the business interview to practise and improve your listening skills.
2A design presentationListen to the presentation about a new product design to practise and improve your listening skills.
3A digital detox podcastListen to the podcast about doing a digital detox to practise and improve your listening skills.
4A lecture about an experimentListen to the lecture about a science experiment to practise and improve your listening skills.
5A talk about motivationListen to the talk about motivation to practise and improve your listening skills.
6Business newsListen to the business news to practise and improve your listening skills.
7Creating a study groupListen to the conversation about creating a study group to practise and improve your listening skills.
8Film reviewsListen to the film reviews to practise and improve your listening skills.
9Getting adviceListen to someone getting advice from a friend to practise and improve your listening skills.
10Joining a gymListen to the conversation about joining a gym to practise and improve your listening skills.
11Office party planningListen to the conversation with an event planner to practise and improve your listening skills.
12Talking about rumoursListen to two people talking about a colleague to practise and improve your listening skills.

C1-Listening

完成时间主题说明
1A job interviewListen to the job interview to practise and improve your listening skills.
2A project management meetingListen to a project management meeting to practise and improve your listening skills.
3An interview about two booksListen to an interview about two books to practise and improve your listening skills.
4Birthday partiesListen to a conversation about birthday parties between three friends to practise and improve your listening skills.
5Catching up after a tripListen to two friends talking about a recent trip abroad to practise and improve your listening skills.
6Challenges at workListen to four people talking about different business challenges to practise and improve your listening skills.
7Innovation in businessListen to the business podcast about innovation to practise and improve your listening skills.
8Introverts – redressing the balanceListen to a talk about social psychology to practise and improve your listening skills.
9Renting a houseListen to four different people talking about their experiences with renting accommodation to practise and improve your listening skills.
10Tech addictionListen to the radio programme about tech addiction to practise and improve your listening skills.
11The helixListen to a lecture about the helix shape to practise and improve your listening skills.
12The history of hand gesturesListen to a lecture about the history of hand gestures to practise and improve your listening skills.

A2-Speaking

完成时间主题说明
12024-03-21 09:01ApologisingIn this video, Paul says sorry for making Noelia fall over. Listen to the language they use for apologising and practise saying the useful phrases.
22024-03-21 09:02Giving instructionsIn this video, Vanya helps Emir learn how to use a new coffee machine. Listen to the language Vanya uses to give instructions and practise saying the useful phrases.
32024-03-21 09:03Showing interestIn this video, Bob tells Noelia about when he broke his leg. Listen to the language Noelia uses to show interest and practise saying the useful phrases.
42024-03-21 09:04Talking about personal interestsIn this video, Emir asks Paul about his hobbies. Listen to the language they use for talking about personal interests and practise saying the useful phrases.
52024-03-21 09:05Talking about your jobIn this video, Vanya, Emir and Paul have a training session. Listen to the language they use for talking about their jobs and practise saying the useful phrases.

B1-Speaking

完成时间主题说明
12024-03-21 10:01Agreeing and disagreeingIn this video, Emir and Paul discuss a design for a client. Listen to the language they use for agreeing and disagreeing and practise saying the useful phrases.
22024-03-21 10:02Asking a favourIn this video, Noelia asks Paul for some help. Listen to the language Noelia uses to ask a favour and practise saying the useful phrases.
32024-03-21 10:03Keeping a conversation goingIn this video, Noelia and Bob talk about Spain. Listen to the language they use for keeping a conversation going and practise saying the useful phrases.
42024-03-21 10:04Meeting face-to-faceIn this video, Noelia and Vanya meet each other for the first time. Listen to the language they use for meeting face-to-face and practise saying the useful phrases.
52024-03-21 10:05Responding to newsIn this video, Noelia gets good news and bad news. Listen to the language Yuna uses to respond to Noelia’s news and practise saying the useful phrases.

B2-Speaking

完成时间主题说明
12024-03-21 11:01Challenging someone’s ideasIn this video, Vanya tells Paul and Emir about her latest idea. Listen to the language they use for challenging someone’s ideas and practise saying the useful phrases.
22024-03-21 11:02Dealing with a problemIn this video, Vanya goes to Yuna with a problem. Listen to the language they use for dealing with a problem and practise saying the useful phrases.
32024-03-21 11:03Discussing advantages and disadvantagesIn this video, Noelia and Yuna talk about how to encourage creativity in the office. Listen to the language they use to discuss advantages and disadvantages and practise saying the useful phrases.
42024-03-21 11:04Giving adviceIn this video, Paul and Bob try to help Noelia with a problem. Listen to the language they use for giving advice and practise saying the useful phrases.
52024-03-21 11:05Persuading someone to do somethingIn this video, Noelia tries to convince Paul to DJ at the office party. Listen to the language Noelia uses for persuading Paul to do something and practise saying the useful phrases.

A2-Reading

完成时间主题说明
1A message to a new friendRead a direct message on social media to practise and improve your reading skills.
2An airport noticeRead a notice at the airport and answer the questions to practise reading important information.
3An email from a friendRead an email about plans for the weekend to practise and improve your reading skills.
4An end of term reportRead an end of term report to practise and improve your reading skills.
5An infographic on the forgetting curveRead an infographic about forgetting to practise and improve your reading skills.
6An invitation to a job interviewRead an email invitation to a job interview to practise and improve your reading skills.
7Choosing a conference venueRead two adverts for corporate venues to practise and improve your reading skills.
8English course prospectusRead the prospectuses for two different English courses to practise and improve your reading skills.
9Professional profile summariesRead two professional profile summaries to practise and improve your reading skills.
10Study skills tipsRead the study skills tips to practise and improve your reading skills. You’ll learn some great study tips at the same time!

B1-Reading

完成时间主题说明
1A conference programmeRead the programme for a management conference to practise and improve your reading skills.
2A flyer for a gymRead a flyer promoting a new gym to practise and improve your reading skills.
3A travel guideRead a travel guide about Bangkok to practise and improve your reading skills.
4An email request for helpRead an email asking for help from another department to practise and improve your reading skills.
5Digital habits across generationsRead an article about how people at different ages use computers and smartphones to practise and improve your reading skills.
6Encyclopedia entryRead an encyclopedia entry on the Taj Mahal to practise and improve your reading skills.
7How to spot fake newsRead some tips for spotting fake news to practise and improve your reading skills.
8Innovation in businessRead a blog post about being innovative in business to practise and improve your reading skills.
9Planning an eventRead a dialogue where three people negotiate who does what to achieve a task.
10Robot teachersRead an article about robot teachers to practise and improve your reading skills.
11Social media influencersRead a blogpost about the impact of social media influencers in the business world to practise and improve your reading skills.
12The legend of fairiesRead a text about the legend of fairies to practise and improve your reading skills.
13The Martian: a book reviewRead a review of the book ‘The Martian’ to practise and improve your reading skills.

B2-Reading

完成时间主题说明
1A Plastic Ocean: a film reviewRead a review of the film ‘A Plastic Ocean’ to practise and improve your reading skills.
2A short story extractRead a section from a short story to practise and improve your reading skills.
3An email from a friendRead an email from a friend you haven’t heard from for a long time to practise and improve your reading skills.
4AsteroidsRead a scientific article about asteroids to practise and improve your reading skills.
5Cultural expectations and leadershipRead an article about the different cultural expectations of a leader to practise and improve your reading skills.
6Instant messagesRead a conversation by instant messages to practise and improve your reading skills.
7Millennials in the workplaceRead a report on millennials in the workplace to practise and improve your reading skills.
8Star Wars and the hero mythRead about how the film Star Wars follows a pattern found in myths to practise and improve your reading skills.
9The Buy Nothing movementRead about the Buy Nothing movement and answer the questions to practise and improve your reading skills.
10The sharing economyRead about the sharing economy to practise and improve your reading skills.
11Why bridges collapseRead a civil engineering article about why bridges fall to practise and improve your reading skills.
12Work–life balanceRead what four people have to say about their working hours to practise and improve your reading skills.

C1-Reading

完成时间主题说明
1A biography of Kilian JornetRead a biography of mountain runner Kilian Jornet, who climbed Everest in a day, to practise and improve your reading skills.
2A threat to bananasRead a text about a fungus threatening bananas to practise and improve your reading skills.
3Cultural behaviour in businessRead a blog post about doing business in different cultures to practise and improve your reading skills.
4Four book summariesRead a series of short book summaries to practise and improve your reading skills.
5Giving and receiving positive feedbackRead a magazine article about giving feedback at work to practise and improve your reading skills.
6Horror film clichésRead an article about horror film clichés to practise and improve your reading skills.
7How humans evolved languageRead an academic text about how humans evolved language to practise and improve your reading skills.
8Life on MarsRead an article about life on Mars to practise and improve your reading skills.
9Managing a problemRead an email managing the problems faced by a member of an international team.
10Political manifestosRead four political manifestos to practise and improve your reading skills.
11Sustainable supermarketsRead an article about how some supermarkets have become more environmentally friendly to practise and improve your reading skills.
12The state of the worldRead an article about the state of the world to practise and improve your reading skills.

A2-Writing

完成时间主题说明
1A personal profileLearn how to write a personal profile for a social app or website.
2An accommodation formLearn how to fill in an accommodation preference form.
3An email about a business eventLearn how to write an email about a business event.
4An email cover letterLearn how to write a cover letter or email to respond to a job advert.
5An email explaining a problemLearn how to write an email to explain a problem.
6An email to ask a colleague to do somethingLearn how to write an email to ask a colleague to do something.
7An expression of interestLearn how to write an email to ask for more information and express interest.
8An online discussion forumLearn how to write posts on an online forum.
9Instructions for a colleagueLearn how to write instructions for a colleague.
10Messaging to cancel a planLearn how to write text messages to cancel plans.
11Messaging to make plansLearn how to write messages to make plans with friends.
12My last holidayLearn how to write about your last holiday.

B1-Writing

完成时间主题说明
1A class forumLearn how to write a post on a class forum.
2A professional profileLearn how to write a professional profile.
3A report on a student meetingLearn how to write a report.
4A restaurant reviewLearn how to write a restaurant review.
5A thank-you messageLearn how to write a thank-you message to a colleague.
6An email giving holiday adviceLearn how to write an email to give holiday advice.
7An email to explain an accommodation problemLearn how to write an email to explain a problem with your accommodation.
8An email to invite someone to a job interviewLearn how to write an email to invite someone to a job interview.
9Describing a bar chartLearn how to write about trends in a bar chart.
10Describing chartsLearn how to write about charts.
11New Year’s resolutionsLearn how to write about your New Year’s resolutions.
12Reflective writingLearn how to write a reflective text about a learning experience.

B2-Writing

完成时间主题说明
1A covering emailLearn how to write a covering email to accompany a job application.
2A CVLearn how to write a curriculum vitae, often called a CV in the UK or résumé in American English.

entry.title: 【磨耳朵英语】02 英文听力-中级篇-英国人正常语速
entry.content:
【磨耳朵英语】02 英文听力-中级篇-英国人正常语速

        
        
English
  1. Turn left at the intersection and Starbucks will be on your right.
  2. May I please have a black coffee with a splash of milk.
  3. A cold front warning was just issued a few minutes ago.
  4. You should make exercise part of your daily routine.
  5. Is there anything in particular you would like to tell me.
  6. We have been having heavy showers on an off all day.
  7. She is a talkative person so she can make friends everywhere.
  8. You will be in hot water if you continue to be late for work.
  9. I’ve lost my appetite because of my aching tooth.
  10. You keep making the same mistakes time after time.
  11. A great way to eat fruit and vegetables together is in a salad.
  12. The dessert will spoil if you don’t keep it in the fridge.
  13. These eggs had gone stale because they were bought two weeks ago.
  14. The departure gate for your flight has been changed to c25.
  15. Please cover your mouth with a tissue when you sneeze all right.
  16. There are five members in my family and I am the youngest one.
  17. We put Emma on a dating app and we’re seeing what’s out there.
  18. Have you seen the remote control for the tv anywhere.
  19. We’ve spoken on the phone but never face to face.
  20. The medicine left a bitter taste in the back of my throat.
  21. Would you mind buying me a bottle of soy sauce on the way home.
  22. We also need a carton of eggs and a pack of toilet paper rolls.
  23. These waffles are crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside.
  24. Can we stop fighting and deal with this issue peacefully.
  25. An escape room is a great thing to try with a bunch of friends.
  26. Salt water is a good home remedy for a sore throat.
  27. She looked weak because she went on a diet for half a month.
  28. My dad warned me not to hang out with friends in the evening.
  29. It’s cheaper to travel during the off peak season.
  30. Take some hand warmers in case the weather is extremely cold.
  31. There is an earthquake preparation practice next Sunday.
  32. Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.
  33. The doctor said my leg should be better in a couple of days.
  34. If you speed up your work we can finish before it is dark.
  35. She always tried to dress down on her first date with a man.
  36. You shouldn’t just assume things without getting all the facts.
  37. I have an appointment with my dentist for a teeth cleaning tomorrow.
  38. He just cannot tolerate any back talk from his children.
  39. She looked absolutely fabulous in her dress.
  40. Sorry I’d like to cancel my reservation for Wednesday evening.
  41. Encourage your child to read all kinds of books for fun.
  42. There are big sales going on all week in this Supermarket.
  43. The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.
  44. You have slight diara avoid eating foods that are too oily or fried.
  45. She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends.
  46. Do not drink cold drinks or eat hot food after a tooth extraction.
  47. There is a 20 kilo luggage allowance on most flights.
  48. Do you know of any good restaurants around our hotel.
  49. My boss is generous and treats us to dinner every month.
  50. I can’t believe it’s our 10th wedding anniversary next week.
  51. I always have a splitting headache when I have a high fever.
  52. Those scrumptious chocolates are so hard to resist.
  53. These pills and capsules didn’t take effect immediately.
  54. I like to try different kinds of street food when I travel to another country.
  55. She gives her child a warm hug before he goes to bed every night.
  56. You should rinse your mouth every morning for oral hygiene.
  57. The deposit I made does not match my receipt what should I do.
  58. Please have your boarding passes ready for inspection.
  59. You should make a shopping list so that you don’t buy anything impulsively.
  60. We’ve still got a sporting chance of winning.
  61. Clicking on this link will open a new browser window.
  62. Some passengers were suffering from severe seasickness.
  63. I hear you have been busy renovating your house.
  64. The police refused to accept her version of the story.
  65. You will need permission from your parents to go on the trip.
  66. We often quarrel but we always make it up soon after.
  67. We had the whole house decorated while we were away.
  68. You should learn to live with your feet on the ground.
  69. I have my umbrella with me whether it rains or not.
  70. You’d better tidy up the living room before Mom comes back.
  71. Most jobs are only advertised online nowadays.
  72. I prefer surfing the internet at home to watching the sunrise.
  73. This medicine must be taken on an empty stomach.
  74. Teenagers have a different sense of value than the older generation.
  75. Before the film I bought some popcorn and a drink at the snack bar.
  76. You can buy a variety of food and household items in the supermarket.
  77. You’ll make yourself horse if you keep shouting like that.
  78. It seems that your heartbeat is much quicker than it should be.
  79. I’d like to buy everyone a round of drinks to celebrate my promotion.
  80. Remember not to throw the cigarette butts into the dust bin directly.
  81. The first day we met I noticed that you were too nervous to talk to me.
  82. Jennifer is such a cute girl with a sunny personality.
  83. They spend much of their Leisure Time with their grandchildren.
  84. There’s only a fortnite left to get your applications in.
  85. There will be an extra charge for any additional passengers.
  86. I’ll mention the problem at the upcoming staff meeting.
  87. The bakery has some mouthwatering Savory snacks.
  88. Getting everyone to use the new technology will be tricky.
  89. She was complaining about her nosy parents.
  90. We’re going out to choose some new wallpaper for the bedroom.
  91. Amanda can be rude sometimes but she doesn’t always mean to be.
  92. What’s the best way to get to the amusement park from here.
  93. The little girl spent a whole day preparing the present for her mother.
  94. The boss promised me that he will give serious thought to this matter.
  95. You have to enter a post code when ordering online.
  96. The value of the ring is much greater than its price.
  97. It took us only 4 minutes to get through the customs.
  98. My dad nearly burst a blood vessel when he saw my tattoo.
  99. The waterfall is so loud that you can’t think about anything else.
  100. She always washes her her hands first as soon as she gets home.
  101. I’d like to exchange US dollars for euros what’s the exchange rate.
  102. Dad made us delectable fried eggs and bacon for breakfast.
  103. Would you quit your job if you inherited lots of money.
  104. It’s hard not to be affected by her enthusiasm and cheerfulness.
  105. Durian has a creamy texture with a sweet and savory flavor.
  106. I have some crafty ideas for getting around the regulations.
  107. His success came from good interpersonal skills.
  108. Due to global warming the weather is getting warmer and warmer in winter.
  109. I want to have a dog but I can’t have it because I live in an apartment.
  110. The egg tart had a flaky pastry crust with a creamy filling.
  111. I was gobsmacked when the teacher told me that there was an exam this morning.
  112. He was gutted when his girlfriend broke up with him.
English-Chinese
Part One
  1. Turn left at the intersection and Starbucks will be on your right.
    在十字路口左转，星巴克就在您的右边。
  2. May I please have a black coffee with a splash of milk.
    请允许我喝一杯黑咖啡和一点牛奶。
  3. A cold front warning was just issued a few minutes ago.
    几分钟前刚刚发布了冷锋警告。
  4. You should make exercise part of your daily routine.
    您应该将锻炼作为日常生活的一部分。
  5. Is there anything in particular you would like to tell me.
    你有什么特别想告诉我的吗？
  6. We have been having heavy showers on an off all day.
    我们一整天都在下大雨。
  7. She is a talkative person so she can make friends everywhere.
    她是一个健谈的人，所以她可以在任何地方结交朋友。
  8. You will be in hot water if you continue to be late for work.
    如果你继续上班迟到，你会陷入困境。
  9. I’ve lost my appetite because of my aching tooth.
    由于牙齿疼痛，我失去了食欲。
  10. You keep making the same mistakes time after time.
    你一次又一次地犯同样的错误。
  11. A great way to eat fruit and vegetables together is in a salad.
    一起吃水果和蔬菜的一个好方法是沙拉。
  12. The dessert will spoil if you don’t keep it in the fridge.
    如果你不把它放在冰箱里，甜点会变质。
  13. These eggs had gone stale because they were bought two weeks ago.
    这些鸡蛋已经变质了，因为它们是两周前买的。
  14. The departure gate for your flight has been changed to c25.
    您航班的登机口已更改为 c25。
  15. Please cover your mouth with a tissue when you sneeze all right.
    打喷嚏时请用纸巾捂住嘴巴。
  16. There are five members in my family and I am the youngest one.
    我家有五个成员，我是最小的一个。
  17. We put Emma on a dating app and we’re seeing what’s out there.
    我们把艾玛放在一个约会应用程序上，我们看到那里有什么。
  18. Have you seen the remote control for the tv anywhere.
    你有没有在任何地方看到电视的遥控器。
  19. We’ve spoken on the phone but never face to face.
    我们通过电话交谈，但从未面对面。
  20. The medicine left a bitter taste in the back of my throat.
    药在我的喉咙后部留下了苦涩的味道。
Part Two
  1. Would you mind buying me a bottle of soy sauce on the way home.
    你介意在回家的路上给我买一瓶酱油吗？
  2. We also need a carton of eggs and a pack of toilet paper rolls.
    我们还需要一盒鸡蛋和一包卫生纸卷。
  3. These waffles are crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside.
      这些华夫饼外面酥脆，但里面又软又蓬松。
  4. Can we stop fighting and deal with this issue peacefully.
    我们能否停止战斗，和平处理这个问题。
  5. An escape room is a great thing to try with a bunch of friends.
    密室逃脱是与一群朋友一起尝试的一件好事。
  6. Salt water is a good home remedy for a sore throat.
      盐水是治疗喉咙痛的良好家庭疗法。
  7. She looked weak because she went on a diet for half a month.
    她看起来很虚弱，因为她节食了半个月。
  8. My dad warned me not to hang out with friends in the evening.
    我爸爸警告我晚上不要和朋友出去玩。
  9. It’s cheaper to travel during the off peak season.
      在淡季旅行更便宜。
  10. Take some hand warmers in case the weather is extremely cold.
    带上一些暖手器，以防天气非常寒冷。
  11. There is an earthquake preparation practice next Sunday.
    下周日有地震准备练习。
  12. Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.
       明天多云，有阵雨和毛毛雨。
  13. The doctor said my leg should be better in a couple of days.
    医生说我的腿应该过几天就好了。
  14. If you speed up your work we can finish before it is dark.
    如果您加快工作速度，我们可以在天黑之前完成。
  15. She always tried to dress down on her first date with a man.
       她总是试图在与男人的第一次约会时打扮得体。
  16. You shouldn’t just assume things without getting all the facts.
    你不应该在没有了解所有事实的情况下就假设事情。
  17. I have an appointment with my dentist for a teeth cleaning tomorrow.
    我和牙医预约明天进行牙齿清洁。
  18. He just cannot tolerate any back talk from his children.
       他只是不能容忍孩子们的任何背地里话。
  19. She looked absolutely fabulous in her dress.
    她穿着裙子看起来非常棒。
  20. Sorry I’d like to cancel my reservation for Wednesday evening.
    对不起，我想取消周三晚上的预订。
Part Three
  1. Encourage your child to read all kinds of books for fun.
    鼓励您的孩子阅读各种书籍以获得乐趣。
  2. There are big sales going on all week in this Supermarket.
    这家超市整周都在进行大促销活动。
  3. The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.
      房间里的气氛太闷了，我几乎无法呼吸。
  4. You have slight diara avoid eating foods that are too oily or fried.
    你有轻微的腹泻，避免吃太油腻或油炸的食物。
  5. She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends.
    她花了几个小时在电话上和她的朋友聊天。
  6. Do not drink cold drinks or eat hot food after a tooth extraction.
      拔牙后不要喝冷饮或吃热食。
  7. There is a 20 kilo luggage allowance on most flights.
    大多数航班的行李限额为 20 公斤。
  8. Do you know of any good restaurants around our hotel.
    您知道我们酒店周围有什么好餐厅吗？
  9. My boss is generous and treats us to dinner every month.
      我的老板很慷慨，每个月都会请我们吃饭。
  10. I can’t believe it’s our 10th wedding anniversary next week.
    我简直不敢相信下周就是我们结婚10周年纪念日了。
  11. I always have a splitting headache when I have a high fever.
    发高烧时，我总是头痛欲裂。
  12. Those scrumptious chocolates are so hard to resist.
       那些美味的巧克力是如此难以抗拒。
  13. These pills and capsules didn’t take effect immediately.
    这些药丸和胶囊并没有立即生效。
  14. I like to try different kinds of street food when I travel to another country.
    当我去另一个国家旅行时，我喜欢尝试不同种类的街头食品。
  15. She gives her child a warm hug before he goes to bed every night.
       每天晚上睡觉前，她都会给孩子一个温暖的拥抱。
  16. You should rinse your mouth every morning for oral hygiene.
    您应该每天早上漱口以保持口腔卫生。
  17. The deposit I made does not match my receipt what should I do.
    我存入的存款与我的收据不符，我该怎么办。
  18. Please have your boarding passes ready for inspection.
       请准备好您的登机牌以供检查。
  19. You should make a shopping list so that you don’t buy anything impulsively.
    你应该列出一个购物清单，这样你就不会冲动地买任何东西。
  20. We’ve still got a sporting chance of winning.
    我们仍然有获胜的机会。
Part Four
  1. Clicking on this link will open a new browser window.
    单击此链接将打开一个新的浏览器窗口。
  2. Some passengers were suffering from severe seasickness.
    一些乘客患有严重的晕船症。
  3. I hear you have been busy renovating your house.
      我听说你一直在忙着装修你的房子。
  4. The police refused to accept her version of the story.
    警方拒绝接受她的说法。
  5. You will need permission from your parents to go on the trip.
    您需要获得父母的许可才能继续旅行。
  6. We often quarrel but we always make it up soon after.
      我们经常吵架，但总是很快和好。
  7. We had the whole house decorated while we were away.
    我们离开的时候把整个房子都装饰了。
  8. You should learn to live with your feet on the ground.
    你应该学会脚踏实地。
  9. I have my umbrella with me whether it rains or not.
      无论下雨与否，我都会随身携带雨伞。
  10. You’d better tidy up the living room before Mom comes back.
    你最好在妈妈回来之前把客厅收拾好。
  11. Most jobs are only advertised online nowadays.
    如今，大多数工作只在网上发布广告。
  12. I prefer surfing the internet at home to watching the sunrise.
       比起看日出，我更喜欢在家上网。
  13. This medicine must be taken on an empty stomach.
    这种药必须空腹服用。
  14. Teenagers have a different sense of value than the older generation.
    青少年的价值感与老一辈不同。
  15. Before the film I bought some popcorn and a drink at the snack bar.
       在电影拍摄之前，我在小吃店买了一些爆米花和饮料。
  16. You can buy a variety of food and household items in the supermarket.
    您可以在超市购买各种食品和家居用品。
  17. You’ll make yourself horse if you keep shouting like that.
    如果你一直这样喊，你会让自己变成马。
  18. It seems that your heartbeat is much quicker than it should be.
       你的心跳似乎比应有的要快得多。
  19. I’d like to buy everyone a round of drinks to celebrate my promotion.
    我想给大家买一轮饮料来庆祝我的晋升。
  20. Remember not to throw the cigarette butts into the dust bin directly.
    切记不要将烟头直接扔进垃圾桶。
Part Five
  1. The first day we met I noticed that you were too nervous to talk to me.
    我们见面的第一天，我注意到你太紧张了，不敢和我说话。
  2. Jennifer is such a cute girl with a sunny personality.
    詹妮弗是一个性格阳光的可爱女孩。
  3. They spend much of their Leisure Time with their grandchildren.
      他们把大部分的闲暇时间都花在孙子孙女身上。
  4. There’s only a fortnite left to get your applications in.
    只剩下一个堡垒之夜来获取您的应用程序。
  5. There will be an extra charge for any additional passengers.
    任何额外的乘客将收取额外费用。
  6. I’ll mention the problem at the upcoming staff meeting.
      我会在即将召开的员工会议上提到这个问题。
  7. The bakery has some mouthwatering Savory snacks.
    面包店有一些令人垂涎的咸味小吃。
  8. Getting everyone to use the new technology will be tricky.
    让每个人都使用新技术将是很棘手的。
  9. She was complaining about her nosy parents.
      她抱怨她爱管闲事的父母。
  10. We’re going out to choose some new wallpaper for the bedroom.
    我们要出去为卧室选择一些新的墙纸。
  11. Amanda can be rude sometimes but she doesn’t always mean to be.
    阿曼达有时会很粗鲁，但她并不总是故意的。
  12. What’s the best way to get to the amusement park from here.
       从这里前往游乐园的最佳方式是什么？
  13. The little girl spent a whole day preparing the present for her mother.
    小女孩花了一整天的时间为她的母亲准备礼物。
  14. The boss promised me that he will give serious thought to this matter.
    老板答应我，这件事会认真考虑的。
  15. You have to enter a post code when ordering online.
       在线订购时，您必须输入邮政编码。
  16. The value of the ring is much greater than its price.
    戒指的价值远远大于它的价格。
  17. It took us only 4 minutes to get through the customs.
    我们只花了4分钟就通过了海关。
  18. My dad nearly burst a blood vessel when he saw my tattoo.
       我爸爸看到我的纹身时差点爆血管。
  19. The waterfall is so loud that you can’t think about anything else.
    瀑布是如此响亮，以至于你无法思考其他任何事情。
  20. She always washes her her hands first as soon as she gets home.
    她总是一回到家就先洗手。
Part Six
  1. I’d like to exchange US dollars for euros what’s the exchange rate.
    我想把美元兑换成欧元，汇率是多少。
  2. Dad made us delectable fried eggs and bacon for breakfast.
    爸爸给我们做了美味的煎鸡蛋和培根作为早餐。
  3. Would you quit your job if you inherited lots of money.
      如果你继承了很多钱，你会辞职吗？
  4. It’s hard not to be affected by her enthusiasm and cheerfulness.
    很难不被她的热情和开朗所影响。
  5. Durian has a creamy texture with a sweet and savory flavor.
    榴莲具有奶油质地，带有甜味和咸味。
  6. I have some crafty ideas for getting around the regulations.
      我有一些狡猾的想法来规避法规。
  7. His success came from good interpersonal skills.
    他的成功来自良好的人际交往能力。
  8. Due to global warming the weather is getting warmer and warmer in winter.
    由于全球变暖，冬天的天气越来越暖和。
  9. I want to have a dog but I can’t have it because I live in an apartment.
      我想养一只狗，但我不能养它，因为我住在公寓里。
  10. The egg tart had a flaky pastry crust with a creamy filling.
    蛋挞有片状的糕点皮，馅料是奶油状的。
  11. I was gobsmacked when the teacher told me that there was an exam this morning.
    当老师告诉我今天早上有考试时，我大吃一惊。
  12. He was gutted when his girlfriend broke up with him.
       当他的女朋友和他分手时，他被掏空了。

entry.title: 【磨耳朵英语】01 英文听力-中级篇-美国人正常语速
entry.content:
【磨耳朵英语】01 英文听力-中级篇-美国人正常语速

        
        
English
  1. The bus stop is just across the street from Walmart.
  2. I wish to lose weight so that I can wear this dress.
  3. We haven’t talked to each other for over a month.
  4. Would you boil some water for coffee please.
  5. I promise that I will never get mad at you again.
  6. You’ve made great progress in such a short time.
  7. I heard that a typhoon is coming up this weekend.
  8. Why didn’t you go jogging with us this morning.
  9. I don’t want to talk to anyone so leave me alone.
  10. We should have some desserts after the big meal.
  11. Is there anything worth watching on TV now.
  12. You won’t get that job if you don’t give it a shot.
  13. I have to think twice before I make any decisions.
  14. The key to do exercise is to do it regularly.
  15. I haven’t measured my height for a long time.
  16. Excuse me is there a department store nearby.
  17. The stores won’t open until 11:00 on weekends.
  18. Fortunately we got home before it started to rain.
  19. Exercise is important if you want to have a healthy lifestyle.
  20. I really have no idea what teenagers are thinking.
  21. Too much soy sauce can make a dish too salty.
  22. I think I can only refund half of the money to you.
  23. I get a headache when I wear my glasses.
  24. I asked my boss if I could take a sick leave today.

entry.title: 【英语泛听】01 如何像本地人一样说英语？
entry.content:
【英语泛听】01 如何像本地人一样说英语？

        
        
English
My story starts in Moscow.I was 15 years old.
My best friend and I, we were part of a group of Westerners,visiting the Soviet Union.This was in 1987,a few years before the fall of the communist regime.
We were given an official tour guide who was assigned to us.
And the tour would start in the morning,and we were checked in to our hotel rooms for the night.
My friend said to me, ‘’Let’s go outside and look at the city.’’
I thought it was a great idea.
Dumb idea.
So we grabbed our coats, and we snuck out past security and into the street.
We found the entrance to the metro.
The Moscow underground transportation system is the deepest one in the world.
The ride down the escalator took a full minute.
Once we were down there, my friend headed right to an open train,and I pulled him back and said, ‘Wait!
Let’s write down the name of the station so we can find our way back.’So I had a notepad, and I took a notepad,and I wrote down the letters of the station,and we hopped down the train and went on train hopping.
And that was fun because -Well, actually, it was weird.
There were a lot of people, probably all coming home from work.
They were all dressed in brown and gray clothes,and it looked very, very different from what we were used to at home.
But the stations were lovely.
There were stations with statues, with paintings on the wall,and glass displays.
It was really like museums.
We would never have expected that.
And everything was perfectly clean.
Well,what was weird though is that the people - nobody seemed to speak,and everyone seemed to be looking at us and it kind of weirded us out.
So after about 20-30 minutes,we’d had enough and we wanted to go home.
I showed my note to someone and they directed me over there.
Then over there, I showed my note to another person,and they directed us to the other way.
And then a third person directed us sideways.
That was a little confusing.
Aw, then I saw it.
Over the stairs, the sign.
It turned out I had written down the Russian word for ‘Exit.’So we headed upstairs and we found a taxi.
That was great.
And we told the driver, you know, ‘Intourist Hotel,’and then he was willing to take us.
And I remember sitting next to the driver, handing him 50 rubles.
And he looked at me and he said,(Russian) No, dollar!
Fifty dollars?
That was like I don’t know 20 times that amount or something.
That was not an option for us.
So we had to get out of the taxi,and he drove away, leaving us standing there.
It was a cold night,and you know everything was strange for us,and we were teenagers,and we were pretty nervous, didn’t know what to do.
Well, we started walking.
We walked to the end of the block.
We turned the corner.
And 200 yards in front of us, the Intourist Hotel.Well, this experience affected me in two ways.
The first is that anytime after this trip that I would hear anyone speak Russian,I was just cringe.
And the second one is that it taught me the importanceof understanding the local language when you’re traveling.
And it actually led to me learning another four languages fluentlyover the following years.
Now, before I go on, I’d like to know in the audience -Can we have a little bit of light maybe in the audience?
I’d just like to know who’s -By a show of hands, who is not a native English speaker?
It must be 99%.
Anyone who doesn’t speak English, stand up!
Alright, so I can assumeall of you have, you know, gone through the process of learning a language.
Anybody who speaks three or more languages?
Wow, that’s maybe 70%.
Four or more languages, anyone?
That’s still quite a bit.
Anyone speak five or more languages?
Wow, come see me during the break.
To me, learning a language is…
For me, it’s like a deck of playing cards lying faced down on the table.
As you start learning and understanding, the cards start opening up for you.
Now there’s no standard way of classifying this.
But as you learn, you reach certain milestones.
And the first one would be when about 25% of the cards are turned up,you reach like a basic level.
At this level, you have a base vocabulary, some grammar,and you’re able to have maybe very simple conversationsand communicate a little bit.
And your study goes on until you reach this magical point of fluency,what we call being fluent in the language.
Now what does it mean, being fluent in a language?
It means that you’ve turned up more than 50% of the cards in the deck,and that is the point where you have -where the language becomes part of your subconsciousso that even if you don’t use it anymore for 10 years or longer,you will not forget it.
You can get back into it within a very, very short time.
So this is a level where you’re comfortable thinking in a language,and comfortable communicating in a language.
Now, some people go on and, you know, reach like a mastery level.
By that time, you know classic literature in the other languageand have maybe in-depth knowledge of specialized fields.
That’s often the point taken in academia.
For me, when I learned my first foreign language,I had a head startbecause I was born to a German-speaking mother and an American father.
Now, when I was a baby, I didn’t really understandthat what my parents were speaking to me were two separate languages.
But by the time I was two years old, I had figured it all out.
Women speak only German.Men only speak English.Imagine the fun my parents had when they introduced me to couples.
Being a bilingual was actually pretty helpful in learning my first language.
It definitely helped.
If you’re -But it also gave me something else.
It gave me two identities and the ability to switch between them.
When you’re a native speaker of more than one language,then your personality, your humor, your value system,they change as you switch languages.
This can have huge advantages.
I mean, some studies have shown an increased problem-solving abilityor even a higher resistance to Alzheimer’s disease.
But what I’m almost interested inis that it’s actually given me a lot of social benefits.
When you’re a native speaker,then you feel at home among native speakers or in a culture,and also native speakers accept you as one of theirs.
Now is this only relevant to native speakers?
And that’s the big question.
But wouldn’t it be coolif a person learning a foreign language could actually develop another identityand actually enjoy the social benefits of a native speakerthat go beyond communication skills?
Well, that’s what happened to me.
I was able to do that,and I want to show you from my experience how I think this can be achieved.
So if we say this green area here is the level of the native speaker,the first thing to note is that on your way to reaching fluency,there is not really any shortcut.
There are some methods that you can use such as the Burrito Principlewhere you identify 20% of the most effective materials to study.
There are some apps, like stuff for time-spaced learning,that increase vocabulary retention.
They save a little time,but in the end, there’s no way around working with the material, practicing it,until you reach the fluency level.
But the second thing to noteis that going from fluency to mastery is a much slower process,and it requires proportionally more effort.
That’s why most people - they just stop at fluency.
They know how to speak English, good enough,and they don’t even attempt to venture on,and I can understand it.
But the good news is,to get the benefits of a native speaker, at a native-speaker level,you don’t have to go through mastery in the academic sense.
In fact, you can skip this step altogether.
So if you think about it,there are many native speakers do not have an in-depth knowledgeof specialized fields or sophisticated vocabulary.
So, that’s not really what is required.
So how do you do it?
What is required?
Well,I want to give you three areas to focus onwhen you’re learning and interacting with native speakers.
The first is: work on eliminating your accent.
I’m aware I said eliminating.
It should be at least minimizing it.
This is, in my opinion, the most overlooked aspectof language learning today,but it’s also the most important oneto reach what I call a native-speaker level or a speaker-like level.
If you communicate without an accent or almost without an accent,this changes how natives behave towards you unconsciously,and it also gives you an ability to adapt to a new self-image.
The best way that I’ve found -the best exercise I’ve found to improve your pronunciationis what I call the perfect-sentence technique.
What you do is you find a native speaker to help you,and you take a book in the foreign language,you open it at a random page,and you read the first sentence.
Then, you ask a native speaker to rate youon obvious accent, slight accent, no accent.
Then the native speaker will read this sentence back to you.
You have to listen carefully and then you repeat.
And you repeat this process over and over until the native speaker tells youthat he can no longer hear an accent when you read the sentence.
Now, I realize it can take a very long timeeven just to get one sentence right.
But I promise youif you are persistent, and if you patiently work on this,you’ll be amazed by what happens to your accent.
The second area to focus on is using verbs and expressions that locals use.
Now, we all know the situation that vocabulary can be region-specific.
Like, in the US, you use ‘stand in line.’In the UK, you ‘queue.’That’s all good.
But sometimes, the spoken word is so different,the speech is so different from what you get in textbooks,that the books are almost useless if you want to converse with natives.
I want to give you an example.
In the French language, there are words like ‘le travail,’which is ‘my work.’A French person talking to his friend would probably say ‘mon boulot,’which is a completely different word.
The same for ‘the clothes,’ ‘le vestments,’but you’ll hear ‘le fringues.’Or money is ‘l’argent,’but people say ‘le fric,’ ‘le sou,’ or many other expressions for this.
So, obviously I’m only scratching the surface here.
But here you actually have to learn all of these words and expressions one by one.
And of course, you have to interact with natives to do that.
But after you reach a critical mass that you’re comfortable with,it’ll actually be easier when you encounter something new.
You’ll just pick it up in one go, like native speakers would,who hear words or expressions that they didn’t know before.
The third area to work on is adopting cultural traits.
What do I mean by that?
So let me ask you:what does this gesture mean to you?
Any Italians here?
OK, now, depending on what culture you’re from,this could mean something rude,or it could just mean it’s something incredulous,like, ‘Why did you do that?’
Or, ‘How could you?’
Or it could just be signaling food, ‘Give me food!’
Interesting!
In the Middle East,this is just a standard way of signaling ‘Please, wait!’
So these kind of traits you have to internalize,and sometimes, they’re hard to spot,and it takes a lot of active listening.
I want to give you a few more examples.
So imagine I am with three of my friends: an American, a German, and a Frenchman.And, like, we’re walking and maybe the American bumps his head,and his initial reaction might be, ‘Ouch!’
That’s how you say it in English.But the German that, you know, gets, I don’t know, elbowed in the crowd,he would say, ‘Ow-ah!’
And the French person might step on the nail and say, ‘Ay!’
So this, of course, in your target language,this is something you have to observe and also internalize,and it has to become part of you.
If…
Again I’m with these three friends, and I sit with them,and let’s say I serve them tea,and I ask the American, ‘Would you like a biscuit with your tea?’
And if he answers in the affirmative, he might say, ‘Uh-huh!’
And I can ask the German, ‘Do you know what tea this is?’
He’ll say, ‘’Mm- hmm!’’
And then I ask the Frenchman, ‘Do you like this?’
He’ll say, ‘Hmm!’So these difference, they really require active listening.
So all of these three things that I told youwhich is pronunciation,and colloquial speech and adopting cultural traits,they all require that you interact with natives as much as possible.
Ideally, you should fully immerse yourself in the culture.
Now if you have the chance to live abroad for a while, that will be great.
Or maybe live among natives in your hometown.
Perhaps just have a romantic relationship,or even just spend time, you know, with co-workers.
So, romantic relationships, I could do a whole talk about that.
That works really well for these things.
But yeah -So this will be different for everybody, of course.
But even when you’re not around natives, your learning must not stop.
Because what you can do is you can watch TV shows and films,you can mimic the characters,you can write down anything that you haven’t heard of before,and practice that.
I also want to encourage you to learn the lyrics of songs.
Songs are really great because they tell stories.
And they not only help your pronunciation when you sing them,but if they’re emotional,they can anchor these expressions into your active vocabulary.
And it’s like speaking all day and really using the expressions unconsciously.
It’s a great way.
So music, definitely.
The other thing you need to move towards native-speaker statusis the right mindset,and a belief that if you sound like a native,express yourself like a native,talk like a native and act like a native,you’ll actually achieve a native-like level.
So if I could only leave you with one thing today,it would be: work on your pronunciation.
Because pronunciationhelps any stage of the learning process,even in the very beginning.
It’ll speed up everything.
And it also is the key to reaching a native-speaker level,or almost-native-speaker status.
So before I go,I’d like to tell you how I was able to overcome my fear of the Russian language.
It was a very, very elegant solution.
I married a Russian girl.
And I now have little kids in my home that speak Russian to me every day.
So I want to thank you.
(Applause)
And before I go, I just want to wish you(Spanish) A lot of success with your language studies.
(French)
It was a pleasure to present for you today.
(Hebrew)
I wish you lots of success with your studies.
(Yiddish)
Thank you for listening.
Good luck to you all and…
(Russian)
Thank you.
(Applause)

这是一个非常非常优雅的解决方案。
I married a Russian girl.
我娶了一个俄罗斯女孩。
And I now have little kids in my home that speak Russian to me every day.
我现在家里有小孩，他们每天都对我说俄语。
So I want to thank you.
所以我要感谢你。
(Applause)
（掌声）
And before I go, I just want to wish you(Spanish) A lot of success with your language studies.
在我走之前，我只想祝你（西班牙语）在语言学习方面取得圆满成功。
(French)
（法语）
It was a pleasure to present for you today.
很高兴今天为大家介绍。
(Hebrew)
（希伯来语）
I wish you lots of success with your studies.
祝你在学业上取得圆满成功。
(Yiddish)
（意第绪语）
Thank you for listening.
感谢您的聆听。
Good luck to you all and…
祝大家好运……
(Russian)
（俄语）
Thank you.
谢谢。
(Applause)
（掌声）

entry.title: 【B1-B2-Grammar】36 Wishes-'wish' and 'if only'-愿望：“希望”和“如果只是”
entry.content:
【B1-B2-Grammar】36 Wishes ‘wish’ and ‘if only’-愿望：“希望”和“如果只是”

Do you know how to use wish and if only to talk about things you would like to change? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用“wish”和“if only”来谈论你想改变的事情吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how wish and if only are used.查看这些示例以了解如何使用 Wish 和 if only。

That guy is so annoying! I wish he’d stop talking. 那家伙真烦人！我希望他别再说话了。
I wish I lived closer to my family. 我希望我住得离家人更近一些。
If only I hadn’t lost her phone number. She must think I’m so rude for not calling her. 要是我没有弄丢她的电话号码就好了。她一定认为我不给她打电话太粗鲁了。
I wish they wouldn’t park their car in front of my house. 我希望他们不要把车停在我家门前。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

‘wish’ and ‘if only’: 1

Choose the correct option to complete the sentences.

  • Question
  1. I wish I _____ go to work tomorrow.
    wouldn’t have to
    didn’t have to
    hadn’t had to
  2. If only I _____ that to her. She’s not speaking to me now.
    wouldn’t say
    hadn’t said
    didn’t say
  3. He wishes _____ the kitchen in such a mess. He always has to clean before he cooks.
    they wouldn’t leave
    they had left
    they would leave
  4. She wishes they _____ ten years ago!
    would have met
    met
    had met
  5. If only he _____ here now. He’d know what to do.
    would be
    wasn’t
    were
  6. It looks like rain. I wish I ____ my umbrella.
    would have brought
    had brought
    brought
  7. I’m starving. If only there _____ a restaurant open now.
    would be
    had been
    was
  8. I wish people _____ loud music on the train. What’s wrong with using headphones?!
    wouldn’t play
    would play
    wouldn’t have played
  • Answer
  1. I wish I _____ go to work tomorrow.
    wouldn’t have to
    ✔didn’t have to
    hadn’t had to
  2. If only I _____ that to her. She’s not speaking to me now.
    wouldn’t say
    ✔hadn’t said
    didn’t say
  3. He wishes _____ the kitchen in such a mess. He always has to clean before he cooks.
    ✔they wouldn’t leave
    they had left
    they would leave
  4. She wishes they _____ ten years ago!
    would have met
    met
    ✔had met
  5. If only he _____ here now. He’d know what to do.
    would be
    wasn’t
    ✔were
  6. It looks like rain. I wish I ____ my umbrella.
    would have brought
    ✔had brought
    brought
  7. I’m starving. If only there _____ a restaurant open now.
    would be
    had been
    ✔was
  8. I wish people _____ loud music on the train. What’s wrong with using headphones?!
    ✔wouldn’t play
    would play
    wouldn’t have played

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation-语法解释

We use wish and if only to talk about things that we would like to be different in either the present or the past. If only is usually a bit stronger than wish. 我们使用“wish”和“if”来谈论我们希望在现在或过去有所不同的事情。if只是通常比wish强一点。

In the present-在现在

We can use wish/if only + a past form to talk about a present situation we would like to be different. 我们可以使用 Wish/if only + 过去式来谈论我们希望改变的现状。

I wish you didn’t live so far away. 我希望你别住那么远。
If only we knew what to do. 要是我们知道该怎么做就好了。
He wishes he could afford a holiday. 他希望自己能负担得起假期。

In the past-在过去

We can use wish/if only + a past perfect form to talk about something we would like to change about the past. 我们可以使用“wish/if only”+过去完成时的形式来谈论我们想要改变过去的事情。

They wish they hadn’t eaten so much chocolate. They’re feeling very sick now. 他们希望自己没有吃那么多巧克力。他们现在感觉很不舒服。
If only I’d studied harder when I was at school. 要是我在学校的时候学习更努力就好了。

Expressing annoyance 表达烦恼

We can use wish + would(n’t) to show that we are annoyed with what someone or something does or doesn’t do. We often feel that they are unlikely or unwilling to change.我们可以使用 Wish + would(n’t) 来表示我们对某人或某事所做或不做的事情感到恼火。我们常常觉得他们不太可能或不愿意改变。

I wish you wouldn’t borrow my clothes without asking. 我希望你不要不问就借我的衣服。
I wish it would rain. The garden really needs some water. 我希望下雨。花园确实需要一些水。
She wishes he’d work less. They never spend any time together. 她希望他少干点活。他们从不花时间在一起。

  • Question
  1. If only they _____ you for advice before they started the project. You’re the expert!
